description: Configure clump results logic for efficient post-processing. Creates lightweight snapshots of clump geometries and selected attributes at different time instances as binary files. This logic allows for a reduced version of the model state (clump geometries plus clump attributes) to be output and used to re-create the model state. IMPORTANT: Clump result files do NOT replace PFC model state files and models re-created with this logic should not be cycled. Use with model results command to control when/how result files are created and imported.

keywords.name: active
keywords.description: Enable (true) or disable (false) clump result creation

keywords.name: add-attribute
keywords.description: Add clump attribute s to be recorded in results. When the result is re-created, this attribute will be filled. All clump attributes can be listed with the clump list attribute command. Use 'group' and 'extra' keywords for groups and extra variables. See clump attribute command for available attributes.

keywords.name: remove-attribute
keywords.description: Remove clump attribute s from results recording. Use 'group' and 'extra' keywords for groups and extra variables.

notes: Clump result files are for efficient post-processing (e.g., movie generation, residence time calculations)
Clump results act as a utility for efficient post-processing, not for continuing simulations
Models re-created with clump results should NOT be cycled
Use model results command to specify when results files are created and how to import them
Result files contain reduced model state: clump geometries plus selected clump attributes

examples.command: clump results active true add-attribute fragment
examples.description: Enable clump results and record fragment attribute

examples.command: clump results add-attribute displacement add-attribute spin
clump results add-attribute group add-attribute extra
examples.description: Record group assignments and extra variables

python_sdk_alternative.workaround: itasca.command('clump results ...') - Python SDK does not provide results configuration
